events.title: Kasich Privatizes Prisons
events.description: Governor Kasich sells state prisons to CoreCivic (then CCA). Gary Mohr, former CCA executive, appointed DRC Director.

events.title: Private Prison Violence Crisis
events.description: Violence at private prisons up 180-300% compared to state-run facilities.

events.title: Deloitte Builds Unemployment System
events.description: Deloitte contracted to build Ohio's unemployment claims system.

events.title: Unemployment System Vulnerabilities Known
events.description: Security vulnerabilities in Deloitte's unemployment system identified but not fixed.

events.title: DeWine Takes Office
events.description: Mike DeWine inaugurated as Governor of Ohio.

events.title: Corcoran Appointed Medicaid Director
events.description: Maureen Corcoran appointed Director of Ohio Department of Medicaid. She owned stock in UnitedHealth and other MCOs.
events.impact: Will direct $54B to companies she has financial interest in

events.title: Deloitte Payments Jump 212%
events.description: Deloitte payments increase from $18M to $56M under new administration.

events.title: CoreCivic Payments Jump 64%
events.description: Despite violence crisis, CoreCivic payments increase from $26M to $55M.

events.title: COVID-19 Pandemic Hits
events.description: Pandemic causes massive surge in unemployment claims.

events.title: $3.8 BILLION Unemployment Fraud
events.description: Criminals exploit vulnerabilities in Deloitte's unemployment system, stealing $3.8 billion in fraudulent claims.

events.title: Deloitte Gets $62M MORE
events.description: After enabling the fraud, Deloitte receives even more state contracts.

events.title: Yost: 'No Evidence of Wrongdoing'
events.description: AG Dave Yost declares no evidence of wrongdoing by Deloitte despite $3.8B fraud through their system.

events.title: Matt Huffman Becomes Senate President
events.description: Huffman takes leadership of Ohio Senate. He received $5.87M in PAC money, 3.5x more than any other official.

events.title: JMOC Dissolved at 2 AM
events.description: Joint Medicaid Oversight Committee dissolved at 2 AM while investigating Gainwell and Medicaid contractors. Huffman and McColley lead the effort.
events.impact: Removes last oversight of $54B in MCO contracts

events.title: Matt Huffman Becomes House Speaker
events.description: Huffman moves from Senate President to House Speaker, consolidating power.

events.title: Corcoran Returns to Vorys
events.description: Maureen Corcoran leaves Medicaid Director role and returns to Vorys Health Care Advisors.
